results.abstract: Campaign Trail column reports that citizens in 15 states have not had chance to sit through stump speech by Bill Clinton or Bob Dole, or enjoy attack commercial; map (S)
results.snippet: What Campaign?      More evidence that ignorance is bliss: with the general-election Presidential campaign now six weeks old, a new study indicates that citizens in nearly a third of the 50 states have yet to sit through a Bob Dole or Bill Clinton...
results.lead_paragraph: What Campaign? More evidence that ignorance is bliss: with the general-election Presidential campaign now six weeks old, a new study indicates that citizens in nearly a third of the 50 states have yet to sit through a Bob Dole or Bill Clinton stump speech or zap their way through a Presidential attack commercial. Indeed, for most campaign purposes save the final counting of electoral votes, the states might as well be in Paraguay.

results.abstract: Article on late photographer Tseng Kwong Chi notes that about 30 of his photographs are in exhibition East Meets West: The Expeditionary Series, at Julie Saul Gallery in SoHo; photo (M)
results.snippet: Who knows if the photographer Tseng Kwong Chi would have created his wickedly surrealistic persona -- the enigmatic Chinese in what appears to be a Mao suit as the post-modern Everyman -- if a certain maitre d'hotel in a touristy Manhattan restaurant...
results.lead_paragraph: Who knows if the photographer Tseng Kwong Chi would have created his wickedly surrealistic persona -- the enigmatic Chinese in what appears to be a Mao suit as the post-modern Everyman -- if a certain maitre d'hotel in a touristy Manhattan restaurant hadn't treated him the way he did when Tseng showed up in his distinctive uniform. Tseng and his younger sister, Muna, who were in their 20's and poor when they arrived in New York City in the late 1970's, were about to be treated to a good meal by their visiting parents at the Windows on the World restaurant in the World Trade Center.

results.abstract: Shannon W Lucid, commenting on her 188-day sojourn in space, says she feels fine physically and shows no major signs or ill effects from having spent over six months in zero gravity; photo (M)

headline.main: After 188 Days in Space, U.S. Astronaut Readjusts to Earth

results.snippet: Shortly after returning to Earth last month from  an 188-day sojourn in space, Shannon W. Lucid said today, she briefly panicked about having lost her muscular strength.    ''I thought, 'Wow, I really am weak,' '' she recalled, having found herself...
results.lead_paragraph: Shortly after returning to Earth last month from an 188-day sojourn in space, Shannon W. Lucid said today, she briefly panicked about having lost her muscular strength. ''I thought, 'Wow, I really am weak,' '' she recalled, having found herself unable to open the front door of her home here.

results.abstract: Astronaut John E Blaha, who is in midst of four-month tour of duty aboard Russian space station Mir, says he wants to vote on Election Day, but he was unable to secure absentee ballot before leaving planet (S)

headline.main: In Space and Out of Luck

results.snippet: A lot of Americans come up with lame excuses for not going to the polls on Election Day. But not John E. Blaha: his problem is that he is stuck in space.     The astronaut, who is in the midst of a four-month tour of duty aboard the Russian space...
results.lead_paragraph: A lot of Americans come up with lame excuses for not going to the polls on Election Day. But not John E. Blaha: his problem is that he is stuck in space. The astronaut, who is in the midst of a four-month tour of duty aboard the Russian space station Mir, said in a space-to-ground news conference today that he had been unable to secure an absentee ballot before leaving the planet last month.
